p:
At the population level, the large ZIKV epidemic could plausibly have led to either increases or decreases in dengue cases. To determine if either was the case, we compared dengue surveillance data from before, during, and after the arrival of ZIKV. We constructed time series of probable case counts for each state in Brazil (1999–2017)
25, 33, 34 and department in Colombia (2007–2017)
25, 35, 36 (see “Methods”, Fig. 1b, d, Supplementary Fig. 1). In 2017, Brazil had the lowest annual incidence rate (IR) of dengue since 2005 (Fig. 1a) and Colombia had the lowest annual dengue incidence since 2007 (the first year of available data) (Fig. 1c).
